title: Seeking higher margins, Stellantis CEO Tavares lost some core customers
Jill Biden Has Blunt Comment About Her Husband’s Decision To Pardon Hunter
Vietnamese tycoon in race to raise $9bn to avoid execution
description: Vietnamese law states that if she can pay back 75% of what she took, her life will be spared.

title: Musk's record $56bn pay deal rejected for second time
description: The judge said the pay package would have been the largest ever for the boss of a listed company.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: China's AI balancing act — beating the U.S. but keeping the tech from threatening Beijing's rule
description: Prominent AI scientist Max Tegmark said the narrative of a geopolitical battle between the U.S. and China racing to build the smartest AI is a "suicide race."

title: South Korea's inflation climbs in November, but misses expectations
description: Last week, the bank of Korea cut its headline inflation outlook for 2024 and 2025 to 2.3% and 1.9% respectively, down from 2.5% and 2.1%.

title: Israel Builds Bases in Central Gaza, a Sign It May Be There to Stay
description: In recent months, soldiers have demolished more than 600 buildings to create a buffer area and expanded a network of bases, a New York Times analysis of satellite imagery and video footage shows.
author: Aaron Boxerman, Aric Toler, Riley Mellen and Patrick Kingsley

title: Russia and Iran Pledge Support for Syria’s al-Assad Against Advancing Rebels
description: In just a few days, a patchwork of rebel forces has seized control of a broad stretch of land in the west and northwest of Syria. But it’s unclear just how much support Syria’s weakened allies can provide.
author: Vivian Yee
categories: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces

title: Elon Musk $55.8 Billion Tesla Pay Deal Again Rejected By US Judge
description: A Delaware judge on Monday upheld her decision to reject Elon Musk's massive $55.8 billion compensation package at Tesla, denying an attempt to restore the pay deal through a shareholder vote.

title: Harvey Weinstein Hospitalised After 'Alarming' Blood Test, Says His Lawyer
description: Harvey Weinstein was taken to hospital on Monday for treatment after an "alarming" blood test result that required immediate medical attention, and he is expected to stay there until his condition stabilizes, his lawyer said.

title: At Supreme Court, vaping may be frowned upon, but that could change with Trump - NPR
description: At Supreme Court, vaping may be frowned upon, but that could change with Trump  NPRSupreme Court divided over FDA block on kid-friendly flavored vapes  ABC NewsThe morning read for Monday, Dec. 2  SCOTUSblogE-cigarette makers hope Supreme Court will give Trump a chance to greenlight flavored vapes  USA TODAYThe Supreme Court seems likely to reverse a ridiculous decision about vaping  Vox.com

title: Belgium found guilty of crimes against humanity in colonial Congo
description: Court said five women were victims of ‘systematic kidnapping’ by state over forced removal from mothers as small childrenThe Belgian state has been found guilty of crimes against humanity for the forced removal of five mixed-race children from their mothers in colonial Congo.In a long-awaited ruling issued on Monday, Belgium’s court of appeal said that five women, born in the Belgian Congo and now in their 70s, had been victims of “systematic kidnapping” by the state when they were removed from their mothers as small children and sent to Catholic institutions because of their mixed-race origins. Continue reading...
author: Jennifer Rankin in Brussels

title: At least 56 people killed in crush at Guinea football stadium
description: Witnesses say people scrambled to escape after teargas used during pitch invasion at match in NzérékoréAt least 56 people have died and dozens of others were injured in a crowd crush at a football stadium in southern Guinea, authorities in the west African state said.The Stade du 3 Avril in Nzérékoré, the country’s second largest city, was hosting the final of a football tournament in honour of the leader of the country’s junta, Mamady Doumbouya, on Sunday afternoon. Local reports said thousands of spectators were present at the stadium and children were among the victims but did not give a definitive figure in either case. Continue reading...
author: Eromo Egbejule in Abidjan and news agencies

title: Cinderella effect and manosphere: New York Times cites traditional gender roles for Trump’s victory
description: Donald Trump's victory over Kamala Harris in the 2024 US presidential election is attributed to his appeal to young men frustrated by women surpassing them in education and employment. This shift has driven many men to the 'manosphere,' creating tension and influencing voting behavior.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Former Congressional staffer arrested for ammunition possession at the Capitol
description: Michael Hopkins, ex-communications director for Representative Joe Morelle, was arrested for attempting to bring ammunition, including a high-capacity magazine, into the Cannon House Office Building. Following the arrest, Morelle's office terminated Hopkins' employment, underscoring enhanced scrutiny and tightened security protocols at the Capitol.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Biden surges arms to Ukraine, fearing Trump will halt U.S. aid
description: Biden’s Ukraine directive has stirred debate, as some officials worry it will cut too deeply into American stockpiles and jeopardize military needs elsewhere.
author: Michael Birnbaum, Missy Ryan, Siobhán O'Grady

title: Live briefing: Israeli military strikes Lebanese targets after Hezbollah fires on Israel
description: The rebel offensive in Syria started after Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a cease-fire in Lebanon, where conflict has weakened key backers of Syria’s government.
author: Susannah George, Niha Masih, Annabelle Timsit, Adam Taylor
